content.text: Git Staging Environment
Change Platform:
What is the Staging Environment?
The staging environment (or staging area ) is like a waiting room for your changes.
content.html: The staging environment (or staging area) is like a waiting room for your changes.

content.text: You use it to tell Git exactly which files you want to include in your next commit.
content.html: You use it to tell Git exactly which files you want to include in your next commit.

content.text: This gives you control over what goes into your project history.
content.html: This gives you control over what goes into your project history.

content.text: Here are some key commands for staging:
content.html: Here are some key commands for staging:

content.text: Stage a File with git add
To add a file to the staging area, use git add < file > :
content.html: To add a file to the staging area, use git add <file>:

content.code_html: git add index.html

content.text: Now index.html is staged. You can check what is staged with git status :
content.html: Now index.html is staged. You can check what is staged with git status:

content.code:
git
status
On branch master

No commits yet

Changes to be committed:
(use "git restore --staged
..." to unstage)
new file: index.html
content.code_html:
git status

No commits yet

content.text: Stage Multiple Files ( git add --all , git add -A )
You can stage all changes (new, modified, and deleted files) at once:
content.html: You can stage all changes (new, modified, and deleted files) at once:

content.code_html: git add --all

content.text: git add -A does the same thing as git add --all .
content.html: git add -A does the same thing as git add --all.

content.text: Check Staged Files with git status
See which files are staged and ready to commit:
content.html: See which files are staged and ready to commit:

content.code:
git
status
On branch master

No commits yet

Changes to be committed:
(use "git restore --staged
..." to unstage)
new file:   README.md
new file:   bluestyle.css
new file:   index.html

        new file:   bluestyle.css
        new file:   index.html

content.text: How to Unstage a File
If you staged a file by mistake, you can remove it from the staging area (unstage it) with:
content.html: If you staged a file by mistake, you can remove it from the staging area (unstage it) with:

content.code_html: git restore --staged index.html

content.text: Now index.html is no longer staged. You can also use git reset HEAD index.html for the same effect.
content.html: Now index.html is no longer staged. You can also use git reset HEAD index.html for the same effect.
